titles.title: Recorder to Ransel Mi
Recorder and Randsell (3)
Recorder to Randoseru Mi
リコーダーとランドセル ミ☆
竖笛与双肩书包 3☆

anime.description: The siblings of the Miyagawa family yet again continue to stumble into misunderstandings regarding their appearance: the 180 centimetres tall http://anidb.net/ch37714 [Atsushi] looks like an adult, but in fact is actually an elementary school boy. His undertall sister http://anidb.net/ch37715 [Atsumi], measuring only 137 cm, continues to have a hard time convincing others that she is actually a high school student. And Atsumi`s good friend http://anidb.net/ch37716 [Sayo] continues to be smitten with Atsushi`s adult-like appearance. — written by foo2

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: seinen
tag.description: Seinen, literally "young man", is one of the main demographic classifications applied to manga, and, by extension, to anime, especially manga-based ones. As the name implies, seinen works are marketed primarily to an audience of young men; the age range commonly understood to be the target of such works goes roughly from 17 to somewhere in the 40s.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: 4-koma manga
tag.description: Yonkoma manga (4コマ漫画, four cell manga, or 4-koma for short), a comic-strip format, generally consists of gag comic strips within four panels of equal size ordered from top to bottom. (They also sometimes run right-to-left horizontally or use a hybrid 2x2 style, depending on the layout requirements of the publication in which they appear.) Though the word yonkoma comes from the Japanese, the style also exists outside of Japan in other Asian countries as well as in the English-speaking market.

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: law and order
tag.description: Where there is "wealth", there are criminals. It is up to the civil law enforcement, i.e. detectives, Police or Special Squads, to keep the lawless activities in the real world or in cyberspace under control. Note: Do not confuse this with Military presence.

tag.name: police
tag.description: The police (civil servants) are the good guys in the battle against crime. Though they try hard, they are usually outclassed by super-criminals or criminal organizations in anime, requiring the help of special units or some lone hero.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: trapped in the body of a child
tag.description: For some reason, a character in this anime who is a late-teenager or an adult, has their mind trapped in the body of a child. E.g. a former late teenager or an adult is transformed into a child. This can be the result of magic, science, or otherwise.

tag.name: amusement park visit
tag.description: Plot device: All or part of the cast visit an amusement park. Added to show the characters in a more leisurely environment (i.e. other than school or at home). Often used in school settings to "develop" and "further" the relations between the male and female leads in this anime. Can also set the stage for comedic misunderstandings, or private moments with possibly ecchi undertones. Furthermore, it gives the anime creators a chance to show off their characters in non-uniforms (e.g. school uniforms). Also see "pool episode".

tag.name: sibling yin yang
tag.description: In real life, siblings hardly ever act the same. Fiction sometimes takes this to an extreme. Enter Sibling Yin Yang, the occurrence of siblings that are nearly polar opposites. If he`s cool and reckless, she`s responsible and thoughtful. If she`s a spiky-haired hooligan, he`s the nerdy wimpy one. If he`s an immature brat, she`s... well, you get the picture.

tag.name: short episodes
tag.description: Short episodes are regular episodes that are much shorter than the standard length. This means up to and including 10 minutes; shows with episodes that are 11 to 20 minutes in length are http://anidb.net/t6494 [half-length episodes] instead. Not to be confused with http://anidb.net/t6349 [multi-segment episodes], which are regular episodes that are split into several short segments (parts), usually with separate titles and independent storylines.

tag.name: misunderstanding
tag.description: Suggests that a large portion of storyline revolves around a rather large misunderstanding between two or more characters, usually forming long lasting situations of separation or hostility between all those involved. A large portion of the story may be dedicated to gradually working all parties into a mutual understanding to true intentions or changes of heart.

tag.name: live-action imagery
tag.description: This anime incorporates still images and/or video footage of real-world objects and locations into the animation.

tag.name: pool episode
tag.description: An episode playing at the pool, mostly in school, sometimes outside of it when the cast does not have a chance for a beach episode. Usually used for fanservice purpose as it gives the staff the opportunity to draw the characters in swimsuits and raise the DVD sales. The cheap version of the http://anidb.net/t5846 [beach episode]. Other variants are the http://anidb.net/t3444 [onsen episode] and the http://anidb.net/t2830 [furo scene], used when it is too cold for a beach/pool episode. See also http://anidb.net/t2830 [furo scene].

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO EPISODE
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to episode tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what episodes they should be assigned to.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: tropes
tag.description: A trope is a commonly recurring literary and rhetorical devices, motifs or clichés in creative works. This use is a broader redefining of a literary trope, the use of figurative language, via word, phrase, or even an image, for artistic effect, such as using a figure of speech. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Take Ani
character.description: Take is 32-year-old man living next door to Miyagawa.

episode.title: リコーダーとランドセル ミ☆
Recorder and Ransel Mi
Recorder to Ransel Mi
episode.summary: Atsumi stresses over height gaps, Atsushi gets taken into custody by a female cop whenever he`s with Hina, Sayo has her eye on Atsushi... Those days are back again. But this time, a new character is sneaking up on Atsumi... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: あつしとゴマダラカミキリムシ
Atsushi and the White-Spotted Longhorn Beetle
Atsushi to Gomadarakamikirimushi
episode.summary: Sayo is stressing over the feelings she has for Atsushi that never reach him, when suddenly... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: あつしと実習生川内さん
Atsushi and the Student Teacher, Miss Kawauchi
Atsushi to Jisshuusei Kawauchi-san
episode.summary: The new student teacher, Miss Kawauchi, tries to make a move on Atsushi... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 真性と非合法
Inborn Nature and Illegality
Shinsei to Higouhou
episode.summary: The little girl lover by nature, Yoshioka, makes his official appearance... as does the long-suffering Kobayashi. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 沙夜と雨宿り
Sayo and Shelter from the Rain
Sayo to Amayadori
episode.summary: Even though she knows he`s a child, poor Sayo still can`t help how she feels about Atsushi. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 魂の兄弟と実の兄弟
Soul Brothers and Real Brothers
Tamashii no Kyoudai to Jitsu no Kyoudai
episode.summary: As if Yoshioka weren`t enough of a handful, now it turns out he`s Atsushi`s brother?! Another unexpected new character joins the mix, bringing further chaos to the Miyagawa family and friends... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ちっちゃい君と苦悩の日々
Tiny and Days of Anguish
Chicchai-kun to Kunou no Hibi
episode.summary: After constantly suffering at the whims of Yoshioka, Makoto Kobayashi - also known as Tiny - finally resorts to his trump card... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: タケ兄と就職活動中!
Take and Job Hunting!
Take-nii to Shuushoku Katsudou Chuu!
episode.summary: The next-door neighbor, Take, has a tendency to quit jobs as soon as his workplaces romances go awry. But today, something is different... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ミはみんなのミ☆
Mi is for Me and You and Everyone
Mi wa Minna no Mi
episode.summary: Will any conclusion be reached among these supremely chaotic relationships? Or has nothing changed at all? No, no, perhaps the changes just aren`t visible... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: みんなと夏休み-PM-
Everyone and Summer Vacation - PM
Minna to Natsuyasumi - PM
episode.summary: Something good always happens in the wake of something bad? Don`t assume summer vacation will last forever. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: みんなと夏休み-AM-
Everyone and Summer Vacation - AM
Minna to Natsuyasumi - AM
episode.summary: Some lazy, some efficient... everyone handles summer vacation in their own way. Where good things happen, so shall bad things as well... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 揺れる恋心と怪奇! 真夏の悪夢!!
Shaky Loves and Horror! A Midsummer`s Nightmare!!
Yureru Koigokoro to Kaiki! Manatsu no Akumu!!
episode.summary: The whole gang decides to check out a haunted house, each with their own high expectations. Thrilling and chilling developments only accelerate the chaos... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: リコーダーとアカランドセル
OVA
Recorder to Aka Ransel
